name: Coty Hall
text: This location is fairly new, the major lines have died down. I went around 11:30am and there were only a handful of cars in the drive thru. Order accuracy was mostly good. They didn't give me pickles on the sandwich like I asked but they also forgot the dipping sauce I asked for. Ordered a spicy chicken sandwich and an 8 piece nugget combo. Food was good, only slightly room temp. I will be back ofcourse.

name: Why Certainly
text: I agree with the previous reviewer. They need more quality control. Got home and realized they had not given me the food portion of a whole combo meal. Meanwhile the employees had time to talk amongst themselves and have a good ole’ time while serving customers. You guys have got to do a better job with making sure your customers receive all of the expensive food items they have paid for.

name: Alorah Hammond
text: The food taste good but with as many workers that they have in the building someone should double check bags before they go out. I work nearby and have gotten lunch here twice this week and haven’t received my French fries both times. Their frozen strawberry lemonade is DELICIOUS

name: Adriane Perkins
text: Just left this location and waited in drive thru for almost 30 minutes to get home to an old sandwich, hard bread and fresh fries.. All I can say is wow and this store just opened up just a few weeks ago.

name: lewis holmes
text: This Popeyes have bad service at the drive thru. Also,  workers don’t know how to check the receipt and properly give the customer their food. I didn’t receive my chicken sandwich.

name: Demetrius Mills
text: The new EastChase location is awsome.  Very friendly and great customer service.  I do love me some red beans and rice and a few other things on the menu.  Lol.  Or a lot of things on the menu.

name: John James
text: There food is getting greasier, and you have to ask for condiments now....

name: A.E. H. Washington
text: Very poor service because I have been setting here at the drive through for, forever!!!!

name: Ray Ray
text: Would like to file an official complaint the store closed at 9:30 and on their door it states close at 11:00. They have over 6 cars to.pull in and they just advised them that they were close. I'm going to make sure that i get in touch with a higher up because this comes just open and already their service is disappointing. I will report this to whoever this needs to go to until there is improvement. This was on 9/5.

name: Robett Robinson
text: The food was good, just not hot. The take out had a wait but expected

name: Kimberly McIntyre
text: The hostess was super nice. The atmosphere is welcoming. The place is small but we ate outside at one of the tables because it was such a beautiful day. The food was very good! I enjoyed the seafood gumbo and boiled shrimp.

name: george williams
text:
This little eatery in Haleyville is a treasure!
The decor is eclectic & interesting...the atmosphere is comfortable & inviting...the staff is welcoming & hospitable...the music is jazzy & soft, BUT...
the food is AMAZING & authentic 😋
The gumbo is perfect 👌 the shrimp is top shelf, the catfish is excellent, the fries are seasoned just right, even the tartar & cocktail sauces are fresh & delicious...
The "fudgy brownie pie" thingy is to die for, may not even be legal 🤣
We will be back soon & often...5 STARS all day long...just wow 👏

name: Ryan Johnson
text: We had our first visit tonight. Some was good some was not so good. First, they charge for tap water.....who does that? I ordered the shrimp poboy and the wife got the catfish plate. The poboy was good....not the best I've had, but good. I will say the French bread was really good. The catfish plate portions were great, but the fish was kinda bland. There wasn't much seasoning on it. I guess the worse thing was I really wanted the bread pudding..... wouldn't you know it, they were out. Out of bread pudding at 6pm on a Saturday night, btw they only have two desserts. I would go back, but wouldn't order the catfish and hopefully they have bread pudding.

name: Jona Capps
text: Best shrimp po boy I have every had and I have had plenty.  Really cute little place. Highly recommend.  Hope they survive this world we are living in...

name: Katie Cole
text: I was born in Louisiana. This food was like being back home. It takes time and patience to make Cajun food. This restaurant hit it out of the park. Our family of 5 plus grandmother ate and everyone raved. Such wonderful employees too. This place is a MUST! We will be back

name: randall ricketson
text:
Driving through and the colors caught my eye.   Told my wife we had to go.   Didn't disappoint.   Shrimp po' boy, shrimp basket, seafood gumbo, bread pudding were delicious.

I will say watch out for the deck and flooring, little wonky and some of the boards were old (but it is an old building).

name: Katie Corey
text: I’m from FL and came to the small town of Haleyville on business.  The food from this place was fantastic! I had the sautéed shrimp salad and a cup of their seafood gumbo. It was so delicious and the staff was very friendly!

name: Rebecca Davis
text: Love the updates on your building. We ate tonight and shrimp basket and sandwich was very good. Keep up the good work!

resp.text: Thank you. Wait until you see the inside!!!

name: Rena Clark
text: Best red beans and rice I have had in years.   Delicious!

name: Dakota Glasgow
text: The crawfish bowls arent exactly the best , but the Po Boys make up for it .   Great rustic style scenery too !

name: GC Moore
text: Some of the portions were good and some were tiny. Also charged $1.30 for two thimbles fulls of ranch. Shrimp was good.

resp.text: A thimble holds approximately a quarter of an ounce. Our salad dressing soufflé cups are 2 ounces each. We do not sell “thimbles full of ranch.”

name: Lelia Wissert
text: Ate here today with my daughter and her family! We couldn’t decide what to choose because the choices were like Louisiana!! I chose crawfish ettouffe and I tried the remoulade sauce!  Everything was great! Brought gumbo and ettouffe home for my husband!!  He’ll love it too!

name: jack wade
text: Best gumbo in the area! Better than any I've had in Cullman or Houston,  AL

resp.text: Thank you! We appreciate your business.

name: Tanner Myrick
text: Was really really good for the price

name: Aeren Ramos
text: Expensive, but definitely not worth it.

name: Sheila Mays
text: Love the food.

name: Joanie Cook
text: Amazing food

name: Colby Corley
text: I called to make sure the restaurant was still open at 10:20pm. One person said they closed in 40 minutes while another got on a different line and said they closed at 10 repeatedly and then both hung up. I was only 1 min from the restaurant so I stopped by. They were still open. I order my food and then am told there would be a wait for the food to cook. I'm patient and say that's fine and pull around to curbside pickup as instructed. 30 minutes go by so I call back in because they are closing in 8 minutes. They admitted to "forgetting" they had asked me to pull up... I'm the only vehicle in the parking lot that isn't an employee and have been for 20 min.... how do you not know I've been here for 30 minutes!? I feel that this was done on purpose! They were respectful as they admitted the wrong. This is the only reason I'm not putting 1 star. I didn't receive my food until 10:01... That is 38 minutes after I ordered!

name: Dawn Lee
text: Love that they are so personable. Always amazing service.

name: Jason Cannon
text: Man I love me some Popeyes chicken, but this new store is the worst I've ever seen. They're consistently out of spicy chicken and the regular is trash. I haven't received biscuits on any of my door dash orders. I gave them 5 chances before I wrote a review but I won't be going back.

name: Leviticus Waters
text: OMG THE CHICKEN WAS FRESH TASTY AND THE STAFF WAS GREAT.

name: Chris Moore
text: I cant leave 0 stars so this will have to do. Fries were stale and coated in grease with no flavor,  didn't get spicy chicken as asked, and left out sauce. Probably a personal problem but the food made me sick and the taste of the grease was too strong. The sweet tea was probably the best thing I got from there besides service at the window. Lady who took my order sounded rude and still managed to get my order wrong after I repeated myself several times. Dining anywhere including hell would be better.

name: Marina gardner
text: We always try a place a couple of times just to give a business a chance and this is the third and last time we will go to this location.  Slow and always leaving things out of our order.

name: Nikki Rosario
text: Being this just recently opened up near my house, we were so excited. We have gone here 4 times and each time was not the best experience. First time was on opening day, other than the fact that we waited in line for a very long time which naturally we expected, our order was fine. Second time, I ordered a 4 piece chicken, and ended up with an 8 piece. No utensils, no sauce. Third time,  order was completely screwed up, again, no utensils or napkins. Fourth time, order was messed up again and got a diet coke instead of a regular coke (disgusting). Come on Popeyes, at some point you need to get it together or you're going to lose business. We will still keep going because we love Popeyes, but we are almost at our wits end with this place.

name: Tori Tyson
text: Have gone to this location three times and each time they mess up the order rather it’s not counting 8 pieces of chicken in the 8 piece.... or just ordering a Dr Pepper and getting a sweet tea. Read the tickets, pay attention and do the job correctly 🙄

name: Zack
text: I want my sauce. I paid for it. For real, if you're going to charge for it, put it in the bag. That isn't difficult.

name: Daniel Walton
text: I came thru drive thru,and placed a order   And it wasn't correct but when I came back and came inside the shift manager Epiphany smiled at me and I couldnt even be mad anymore she fixed my whole order over and was sooooo sweet  and nice.

name: That Girl Right There
text: The food was amazing! The service was fast and the staff was friendly and polite!

name: Vicki Rayburn
text: Was in drive-thru. Waited for sevaral minutes only 2 cars in front of me. Went to exit and the first car that had ordered was still at window.

name: Susan Miller
text: Went last weekend it was great. Went this weekend not so good. Chicken was way over cooked . Come on popeyes get it together.

name: Kay
text: Customer service is very good. The food is very good.

name: Carla Talley
text: Chicken cooked too hard  ordered a 11 piece didn't get no wings

name: Danielle Hopkins
text: Long wait, didn’t put ice in our drinks, chicken sandwich was so overdone it was inedible. Should have put a Chik-fil-a here. We won’t be back.

name: abdiel acevedo
text: Chicken was burn and hard like is been cooked 4 hours ago. Drinks tasted like water.

name: John Free
text: Just bad service ordered  Mac &cheese  I get to the window they said it was not ready yet should  have told me that at the window over priced

name: benny gray
text: False advertising slow service worker's playing food was cold

name: Amanda Rippy
text: Went on 5/25/21 and the manager was so rude and disrespectful. So loud while she was being rude that my mom on the other end of the restaurant heard her. Probably never returning to this location as long as she’s there.

name: Rufus Berdeaux
text: Long line and I ordered the ten piece tenders and got regular ten piece chicken bummer if didn't live so far away I would go back.

name: Greg Harkins
text: Clean facility and a friendly staff.

name: TMoore Leonard
text: Worst customer service ever!!!

name: Nick Savage
text: The food here is great! The dishes are reasonably priced, and very filling.  The atmosphere is pretty nice as well.  I eat here pretty regularly for lunch, and they are very quick on orders. Unfortunately for them, they are in a pretty poor location, and I feel like they would have a lot more business if they were somewhere they could be seen.

name: Cary Pool
text: Great place for Cajun lunch. They are setup for speedy service with a relaxed atmosphere. On nice days they open the front wall via a good ole garage door opener. I've had about half the bowls on the menu and haven't found a bad one yet. If you have room be sure to try the bread pudding it's delicious.

name: Eric Ibarra
text: Everything I've tried here is excellent. It is extremely fast; I've frequently had my food come out before I even sat down. They also have catering which is great for events.

name: Joey Kim
text:
Different. Found the place driving around to avoid normal fast food.
Glad I did. Been here 2x and been happy both times.

name: Mark VanHooser
text: Great food and very friendly.  not sure what you like.  they have free samples to help you decide.  very reasonable price.

name: Sheila Hadden
text: My husband and I had lunch there. He had the red beans and rice, and I had the Crawfish Etouffee. My etouffee was delicious! It was seasoned perfectly. I like spicy foods and often find many commercially made dishes too bland. Not so this. The right amount of heat balanced with the rice. My husband is particular about his found, and he really enjoyed the red beans and rice, noting that they were made with Camellia Beans. The staff was very helpful, asking if this was our first visit (it was). They offer "tastings" of their dishes so you can decide if it is what you want. Even though there were several people behind us, we didn't feel rushed making our decision--they waited on the next customer, then came right back to us. Very friendly and efficient staff. I'll definitely go back.

name: Christopher Orme
text: Only in town for four days. Great place to grab some great food. I will be stopping by here again when I am in town.

name: Tech Gentleman
text: Awesome place!!! Great food, great service and great atmosphere.

name: Brandy Hicks
text: Amazing food, great staff! Must have, best outside of Nawlins!!

name: Amanda Honeywell
text: Love it! Food is great and filling. Not a huge fan of the nachos, but the entree bowls are to die for.

name: Hanna Kim
text:
Loved this place.
Too sad that this place has been closed now.

name: Sam Woodson
text: Loved this place, wish it would re-open in a better location. ;-(

name: Matt Varian
text: really good food, recommend their voodoo chicken

name: Kimberly Pruett
text: Nasty! All rice. Pasty. Out of gumbo at 1230. Nothing to get lemons but everyone's hands.

name: Sky Whiddon
text: Pulled off the road after a stressful drive (if you can even call it that it was more like a stroll) through a bad accident on I-85. Me and my family were all very pleased with the service. The cashier was friendly, the food was hot, and the service was was great. I highly recommend this location

name: Asia Miller
text: Did not buy anything. They said the system was down. I called later and they said they did not have containers to even sell anything so they were not selling any items at the moment. The guy said "hello" when he answered the phone instead of "Popeyes". They all need training and new management at this location. They need a new computer system. I will not stop here again. I feel that they will not be able to serve me.

name: Douglas Young
text: Would give 0 stars if able.  Sat at drive thru kiosk for several minutes and nobody responded.  Drove to window and were told drive-thru mike is broken.  Also told they were  out of chicken patties and out of Diet Coke. Completely “don’t give a sh*t” staff.  Don’t give this place your business.  They probably don’t have anything to sell you anyway.

name: Lawrence Henderson
text: They are located next to a Love's truck stop. I am a trucker. They allow drive through only. They won't serve you if you walk up to the window. Personnel were very rude. They lost a lot of walk up trucker's while I was there. Told us to go to Burger King next store, that they allowed walk ups at drive through window. Incredibly insane. Lots of lost revenue.

name: swiss faction
text: Horribly rude service. I didn't even order. I pulled up to the window and the girl was singing a rap song with obscene lyrics, and when I asked to order, then she said "you are welcome to come inside." I replied, "is the drive through not open?" And she responded with a "ratchet" attitude. Stating pointedly, "AS I SAID..." then I just drove away. You want to fight for 15/h then act like that? You people are ridiculous.

name: daniel ramirez
text: There's always something wrong in that restaurant, different times, often they don't have what is in the menu, the sweet tea is not sweet, this last time, they took 20 min to make the complete the order, fries were cold, no spicy chicken. This guys put Popeyes name in a bad way! Always something wrong!!

name: Nickie Capps
text:
They were fabulous today (11/20/20 130 pm). Both sandwiches were huge, hot, fresh, as well as came out quickly.

We have continued to get great service and hot food since. Poor guy was basically running the place himself and still moved the line in a timely manner with correct food.

name: Mark Kuehndorf
text: Quick service for drive-thru chicken; my order was accurate; food was delicious.

name: Augusta Bryant
text: Food was cold not even warm. Plus I had to wait over 20 minutes for a simple order. I will not be going back. Service was lazy. 😕👎

name: Fugeta20
text: Great Performance, made my morning. Thank you.

name: Lynn Stauch
text: Delicious food but service is on again and off again. You never know which you will get.

name: mugo ngunda
text: Bad food bad service popeyes should get on this place like serously. This site deserves to be shut down

name: Vee D
text: The absolutely most disrespectful service that I have ever witnessed in my life. Pulled up at the window at 8:40 absolutely no food as the sever was sooooooo rude beyond rude as we pulled to the window she was worse than trying to ordering at the speaker. I love popeyes but this was the worse experience ever. Popeyes Shorter Al  2/19/21

name: Mark Haag
text: From ordering to getting our food was a disaster. We had to repeat everything 3-5 times.  We had her repeat which we thought was right. After getting receipt it was incorrect and she had the audacity to tell us she repeated it back to us already. DO NOT STOP HERE

name: Kenya Williams
text: ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING!!! Worst service I’ve ever seen in any restaurant. Member slammed the door in my face , and it took every fiber of my being not to attack her. The employees really should be fired; there behavior could potentially get them hurt.

name: Curtis Pearsall
text:
Wow!!!  Not in a good way either.   4:30pm on Friday and doesn't have any Chicken ready?

Asked for 12 pc and they refused because they only had a 9 pc special?

Seriously???

Who trains these people?

Just keep driving folks

name: Latifah Starks
text: Slow slow slow most times nothing you ask for they have and staff super unprofessional

name: Anthony Solomon
text: Closed before the time advertised. This place is a joke like most Frenchies in the country South. The worst place you can end up.

name: Kelly McGee
text: The workers were nice and the spicy chicken sandwiches and chicken tenders were good, but something was terribly wrong with the biscuit I almost gave to my 2 year old. My husband took a nibble and said it was salty, so I took a huge bite and it tasted strongly of cleaning chemicals. At first like hand soap, but then burned like something much stronger. This should not happen, ever!!

name: KIRBY CLEMENTS
text: One car at the drive up ordering section, so it seemed promising.  I was wrong.  After several minutes of silence from Popeyes, the person in the lead car started calling out, "Hello".  No one answered.  The third car that had pulled in behind us, after we had been there a bit, finally drove off.  We also left.  As we drove around, there were two or three cars waiting near the window. One was past the window as if waiting on a part of their order. In another car, a convertable, the occupants were literally sunning themselves.  I looked in the store and saw folks and someone who appeared to be the manager standing around.  Given that I am a fried chicken junkie, you have to know that I waited a good bit, and it hurt to b leave as I really wanted fried chicken.  Won't stop there again.

name: Madison Yarn
text: The ugly skinny lady at the window had a bad attitude at the window, me and my mom let it go and pulled up to window. She damn near threw my drink out the window and dropped our card on the ground. Very unprofessional and I won’t be back.

name: Kim Wimberly
text: The supervisor a black older lady was nice nasty because I questioned why my dad was paying $9.17 for a 2pc chicken and 2 sides.  She refused to wait on me and asked a nicer younger lady to take my order.  I wished I could of rated the service a zero, however it wouldn’t allow me to leave a comment unless I highlighted a star.  Then my mother said as she was walking out, she heard the supervisor talking about me to a customer.  How is she the manager?  Popeye needs to hire individuals with customer service experience.  Maybe she needs management training, customer service training, among other trainings.

name: Irene Adler
text:
I was told I can’t have a chicken sandwich without the mayonnaise (or sauce). “Because the chicken sandwiches are pre-made, as advertised”.. I didn’t make that quote up. The manager, literally, told me the sandwiches are pre-made.
The implication being - the sandwiches are made with mayonnaise and are sat in an area where they are kept warm.. That is absolutely disgusting!

name: Joey Sgarlata
text: No friggin reason to have to pay $7 for french fries... 🍟

name: Erin Engelbracht
text: Would give 0 stars if I could. Worst Popeyes on earth

name: Deborah Walker
text: Horrible  we waited  in the drive thru not knowing  they were closed at 812 went to the window  no one address  us  this place needs new management  will never  come again to that location

name: Shelia Jennings
text: My chicken  was old.I didn't  get all my food. I was very  upset. My friend  didn't want to go back.

name: Rodney gream
text: Got there at 5pm. Food must have been left from lunch. Cold hard fries. Chicken dried out from being on warmer for hours. Worst popeye’s I have ever eaten at. Wished I had read reviews before going there. Would have given a zero if possible.

name: Iris Stewart
text: The people at this popeyes was very nice. There service was excellent. The food was great if I travel back that way I will stop there. I highly recommend this popeyes

name: lol
text: Horrible the lady was rude and acted lazy.wouldn’t recommend this at all a-specially at night.

name: Bama Lady
text: When you go to Popeye's be prepared to sit there for a while

name: William Roberts
text: The best of the best. The top gun of chicken.

name: Shateria Lewis
text: Horrible! Need to closed down and everybody on night shift should be fired! We were told, at the drive thru, they were out of chicken, and we heard the workers in the background laughing. We’re traveling and need to get food and they’re playing!

name: Tina Nelson
text: The rip N chicken was hard as a brick and all the employees wanted to do is talk to each other

name: Jimiria Kitt-Wilson
text: Very poor service. Every night we're always greeted with a before you order we only have popcorn shrimp, a few sides and a few biscuits 😔😔 and this is before 9:30 and they close at 10pm. Get home and they still forgot the biscuits!!😡

name: Mark Bowden
text: Hands down, without a doubt the slowest "fast" food restaurant I have ever been to. Never again.

name: Goldie Weber
text: I can't believe this place is still in business, if there not out of one thing or the other they are giving you whatever they want you to have.  I say if your going to disregard my order and give me what you want me to eat then you pay for it.

name: R0cK GoD
text: Extremely friendly. Fast and accurate service. Overall great chicken at a fair price. Better than the truck stop food if your in the area.

name: Paige J
text: When going through the drive through we were unable to finish our order. The lady taking our order told us to pull around. We assumed something might have been wrong with the headset. When we got to the window to try to finish our order she told us that they didn’t take add ons to orders. The woman finally agreed and we told her we needed a regular chicken sandwich. She yelled to the kitchen that she needed another spicy chicken sandwich.....the fries were good. Lol

name: Hannah Johnson
text: Three visits to this location and they always get the sides wrong. You have to wait 20+ minutes for your food and they will not apologize. I also would not recommend paying in cash because they refused to make correct change and stole $5 from me.

name: Dusty Shirley
text: System down at 12:30pm

name: Tanya Taylor
text: Ordered blackened tenders which are on the menu and got to the window and didn’t get what I ordered said they don’t make them... uhm then take it off your menu and don’t try substituting my order without asking.

name: XXPROREAPSXX
text: The cashier was rude and ignorant! She kept several cars at the drive thru for 15 minutes or more before she would take your order! Then I heard her talking about another customer in drive thru over the speaker because she wasn't aware her mic was still on. Then you had to wait another 15 minutes before the chicken would be ready! After all that they didn't have my order right!

name: Emma Blair
text: people were awfully rude!! lady at the front screamed at me! don’t go here!!

name: Chauntia Watson
text: I rarely eat popeyes and tonight I decided why not lets try it. Needless to say I regret it. I still don't have my food and it's been over an hour. 3 cars behind me have now received there food ahead of me.  We were asked to pull up and weight. So I can't pull off because its been paid for. Like the previous comments before me DON'T COME HERE!!!GO TO ANOTHER POPEYS. NEVER AGAIN

name: Adrian Richard
text: When it's fresh hot good and on time, home run baby home run.

name: Miss L
text: KEEP GOING, go on to another stop! Poor service, attitude was bad felt like we were being rushed. Tried to order numerous things but they weren't ready, wait of 10 min or more.

name: Wyatt Peavy
text: Service is very slow I’ve waiting for 45+ twice it’s ridiculous workers were not pleasant and were rude

name: Sidney Hogan
text: The restaurant in shorter Alabama has the worst service and rudess employees in the world.  I can't help life threw them a curve ball.

name: KIM MOWERY
text:
The fried chicken on the bone is so good that I'd probably still eat it even if it had feathers on it.
It wasn't greasy, the crust was crunchy and the flavor was awesome.

name: C Fincher
text: Unbelievably sorry service, didn’t get me the drink but ask me to pull forward and wait. Brought out the wrong order and no drink three times while taking 10 minutes between times. The dining room was closed so not extremely busy.

name: Ally Snyder
text: Employees are very rude. They kept talking over me and were very pushy and mean. Didn't tell us their card reader was down until we were at the window.

name: E C
text: Excellent food, friendly service but some of the dining tables were not clean.

name: Angela Essien
text: Sold out of everything  I wanted. In Shorter Alabama

name: D B
text: The rudest place I have ever went to all I asked for was a lemonade and peach mix drink and the lady was so rude on the drive thru mic she stated “ I just told you we didn’t have that” and argued about it when I asked her nicely I would never come back here again so unprofessional and I drove off will not get my business ever!!

name: Tiffany Crawford
text: TERRIBLE service. I always order the same thing, sandwich with no mayo.  She proceeded to tell me they are pre-made. I told her I always order that way and all she said was ITS PRE-MADE much louder and ruder. Lazy is what they are! I will call corporate tomorrow. Looks like you are known for being so rude by your reviews.

name: Vivian Simmons
text: "Love that chicken from popeye's" .This is exit 22 off I-85 Shorter . Also a Love's McDonald's, subway and nearby burger king, and Charley's philly cheesesteak restaurant.

name: tiffany storay
text: The worst place ever. Just go ahead and shut down. Waste of time sitting in the drive thru (only 1 car ahead of me and nobody tried to take my order for over 10min) only to be told I couldn’t have an order without pickles because it was pre-made.

name: Makayla Davis
text: The old hag of a manager told me i couldn’t get a refund for the dry chicken they gave me. Then she argued about what money I’m suppose to get back saying i can just get some more chicken when i get off work or tomorrow. She was  very raggedy and rude. Finally got my refund

name: jack shiver
text: Real cold inside

name: YaBoy Drizzy
text: I just came from there and they didn’t have no food Only thighs and only had one chicken samwhich they need to shut that place down I would give it a zero if I had it. That is thrash 😡😡

name: Keenon Gresham
text: Lady in drive through ruined my day

name: Brandon McNeil
text: The female manager was extremely rude. And service was slow as hell!

name: GIG Terry J Sayles Sr.
text: I just learned of this location and I must say they are on point.... the food was fresh and hot, and the Service is Off The Chain!!! Fast,  Friendly, and Fresh!!!!  A++

name: Mike Lane
text: Nothing fast about this place. The guy working the inside register apperantly had 2 speeds. Extremely slow and stop.

name: Francisco Rios
text: Very bad services

name: Sandy Norris
text: I have never seen such slow people, there was 10 or more people waiting on orders and the manager or who ever she was took back everyone's ticket and was filled orders that way.  I did not order the new chicken sandwich so it shouldn't have been a problem filling my order quicker.  First and last time there.

name: A P
text: After 15 min waiting time they asked what we ordered. No receipts were given out to any customers. No apologies. No napkins provided.  Costumer "service" foreign word there.

name: Mary Cook
text: We was out town eating good chicken

name: krissa smith
text: Awesome customer service. Fast and courteous customer service. Hot fresh food.

name: Jay Moorer
text: The service is extremely slow, and not sure why. Looks like a lot of employees on break at the same time . And one lady trying to do it all . Food was typical

name: Doublet Family Channel
text: The cashier is miserable with her job. She had a frown the whole time we picked up our order from the drive through. She also rushes us as we tried to order a meal for our group of 6 people. Find another popeyes.

name: Sarah Smiley
text: I love popeyes livers

name: Todd Cockrum
text: Had their chcken sandwich in Texas and i enjoyed it... this location not so much...

text: Fantastic food. Mac n cheese is phenomenal. Gouda grits are to die for. The staff are courteous and the decor is soulful. Plenty of great beer and a well designed outdoor play area for dogs and kids.

text: Good mix of food items offered. Burgers are outta this world, especially the fantabulous Tony Burger! Food always hot and fresh. Interesting and cute owl decor.

name: Chelsea Rainey
text: We have eaten dinner here two nights in a row. The Cheesy Crawfish Tater Bake is amazing! Burgers are too! Actually there's not been anything on the menu that we haven't liked. Not crazy about the Mexican cornbread that they bring to the table, but I'm not that in to cornbread anyway. Atmosphere is great with helpful and enthusiastic servers!

name: Arlene Dean
text: Cold & undercooked food. Waitress, Lindsay, as she yelled it to us, never mentioned the cocktail menu even though she paced by our table 9 times to hang with her fellow wait staff at the bar before we ordered. A response of "I don't know. Eat a salad." when I asked if there were any vegetarian plates (many restaurants here prepare them but don't have them on the menu. Clearly not this one.) Didn't advise us of any specials, and only brought half of one of our party's meal out.  The fish was so cold, we were grateful we didn't purchase one of the $23 plates.  The prices do not match the atmosphere, nor the service, nor the lack of cleanliness.  When we located a cocktail menu, there was something sticky all over it.  Luckily another waitress brought out the rest of our party's meal. It was the only properly cooked & warm item we received. After sharing our experience with locals we found out most people only go here for occasional drinks, not the food, but since we weren't even advised of the drink menu I can't even recommend that.  If you have any type of health conditions or are trying to eat healthy, I recommend an avoidance of this establishment.

name: Andrew Hendon
text: A great, locally owned restaurant with excellent food and a cool atmosphere. Cost is on target with a nice chain restaurant, but the food is much better than any chain. Recommend the burgers, shrimp poboy, and shrimp creole.

name: Tara Gardner
text: Love this so cool restraunt!! Everything on the menu is great. Appetizers are off the chain!! 04/30/2018 edit:  This restaurant is now closed.

name: Jake Yde
text: While the food was decent it was also over priced. We really weren't expecting to pay over $75 for a 3 person meal. How is that fair pricing? There was absolutely no alcohol on the ticket either to increase the price. Together we ordered a burger, pasta, and the catch of the day, three soft drinks, two sides, nothing extravagant.  As far as service as soon as the check was brought out my glass remained empty with the server never noticing. It was like once they had their money the service was gone. I personally do not intend on returning.

name: Jennifer Ireland
text: Everything was awesome! We were greeted very pleasant hostesses and our server all about it (as my teenagers said)! Will definitely recommend it to everyone.

text: Outstanding beer selection and the menu is great.  However the service has gone down and prices up.

text: Easy going atmosphere and the food was great. Also dog friendly!

text: Great Place. Good but not amazing food, great beer selection, nice seating outside with live music from time to time and the best is that they have a bounce castle outside. If you are with kids they will love it!

name: Holly Younce
text: Went here two weekends ago and the service and food were horrible except for the mac n cheese. We were there for almost 2 and a half hours. 30 minutes waiting on a table, 45 minutes waiting to order and receive our food. 30 minutes to eat and then another 45 minutes to get our check. When I expressed our dissatisfaction with the very unprofessional looking "manager" on duty he just said, "Sorry, we're busy tonight". This is the second terrible experience my family has had there. We were hoping the last visit was just a fluke. We definitely won't be back.

name: Kristin van't Hoff (kvanthoff)
text: Owner, Tony Nicholas has stepped up his game substantially. Went for brunch last Sunday and it was spectacular. Have dined here previously and was less than impressed, but I have to say they have done a great job in improving food quality as well as the quality of service. I ordered the Owl Benedict, their take on eggs benedict with a crawfish and alligator patty, fried green tomato, red tomato, bacon, poached egg and hollandaise sauce. It was divine! Our table also shared the oyster sampler platter, which I highly recommend. The blue cheese and bacon, egg, and cheese oysters were our favorites. Would definitely recommend dining here for brunch to any and everyone. I have noticed major changes in the past month at this restaurant and it is great to see this place restoring itself back to it's glory days.

name: Katie Champion
text: The food was terrible. One piece of sausage on a hard piece of french bread. Claimed to be a bbq sausage poboy, the sauce was in a cup on the side.  The onions were a mystery,  as some were bright purple and raw, while others were black and overcooked. $10 for the strange sandwich with about 3 fries. They were out of the first 4 or 5 things we tried to order. They had an extensive beer menu, but were also out of several lines of beer. It took forever to get our measley food. Would not recommend based on all of these things.

name: Robert Harding
text: Having seen the overflow crowds, I was naturally curious what the restaurant was like. After finally going for lunch today, I can say with certainty that this place is vastly overrated. Based on the menu selections, it's supposed to be a quasi-Cajun/Creole place. Dishes such as crawfish pasta and alligator are represented on the menu, however there are two big problems. First, the food is incredibly bland. Having eaten in New Orleans more times than I can remember, I would say the chef has toned down the food to cater to a broader (i.e., non-New Orleans) audience. The result is less than stellar. Second, the prices are way over the top. $15 for a simple pasta dish with only a couple of crawfish in the sauce is beyond the pale. The place is attractive enough and the service pleasant, but not enough to justify the emptying of my wallet on mediocre food. I'll not be returning so long as I'm paying.

resp.text: Sooo wonderful we appreciate you lots, hope to see you again soon. Happy you enjoyed your food. Next time you remind me to give you that well deserved military discount : )

name: Chip Dalton
text: Friendly staff with incredible food! My food came out hot and fast, If I wouldn't have been so hungry I would've taken a picture. I tried both the roast beef and sausage patty po'boy and they were so good.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind words. We appreciate your business and hope to see you again real soon.

name: Kip Morrissette
text: Everything I've had has been excellent. My favorite is something I wouldn't have thought I'd be ordering but it's a FAVORITE now, 'Hot Sausage Patty Po'Boya' with Cheese and standard Red Onion and sliced Pickles. Haven't had anything I haven't enjoyed.  Super owners and it's NOT a FRANCHISE, just family owned.

resp.text: We are so happy you enjoyed, it’s going to be hard to have another cheese burger again after the hot sausage  Po’Boy lol... see you again soon, and thank you lots.

name: Cassandra Huffman
text:
Absolutely delicious and very friendly staff! We just moved here and ate at Po'Boys Paradise on our first night in town - based off reviews. They did not disappoint. Shrimp Po'Boy, Gumbo, burger and Gravy (for the fries) were all delicious. You will not be disappointed. We will definitely frequent.
Highly recommend!

resp.text: Thank you very much we appreciate you, welcome to our wonderful little town, look forward to having you all as local regulars 😃😍

name: Hadashah Jael
text: The seafood 🦐 is awesome and the owners are friendly - highly recommend shrimp platter, onion rings, gumbo ❣️  This is a REAL local restaurant. Wonderful, very clean too!

resp.text: Thank you so very much for your review it is very much appreciated. See you again real soon.

name: Dan S
text: I keep forgetting to write my review. I've eaten here twice now. I've tried at least five things and will say that everything has been very good. I hope they continue to succeed!

resp.text: We greatly appreciate you taking the time to write a review. We will continue to provide great food and customer service. Can’t wait to have you in again.

name: Kelvin Allen
text: Excellent food, excellent service great experience. Keep up the good work.

resp.text: Thank you sooo much. We appreciate it lots. Hope to see you all again 😊

name: Tony Vidal
text: These people are the greatest...down to earth, family first, and dont get me started on the food...if you dont check them out you are missing the BEST po boys outside of the BIG EASY...I should know I'm from there..keep up the good work..who dat....

resp.text: This is truly appreciated. Support from customers like you make everything worthwhile. We can’t wait to see you again and you are definitely part of the Po’Boys Paradise family. Who Dat!!!!!!

name: Zach Rutledge
text:
Everything I’ve tried here has been really good so far.  The family that runs it is really nice, too.  The menu is pretty small but they seem to put effort into everything they sell.  Case in point, the roast beef is tender and the gravy homemade.  That same gravy graces the Glory Fries, and they are a savory alternative to sad regular fries.  Speaking of which, the fries here are not “regular” at all!  They are some sort of unusual ribbon cut that’s folded almost in half.  It’s a design that maximizes the outer crunch while preserving the interior’s soft creamy center and holy cow why isn’t everyone making fries this way!?  There are a couple of seasonings you can add to them; I sampled the Cajun one and it’s slightly spicy, but my favorite will always be the Glory Fries since cheese plus gravy = heaven.

The bread for the po-boys is excellent quality as well.  Too often down here I’ve eaten po-boys where the bread is either incredibly chewy to the point it’s almost inedible, or so heavily toasted it dissolves into crumbs on the first bite.  But not this.  It’s tender on the inside and has just the right light crispness on the exterior.

I’ve also had a cup of the gumbo and it really is some of the best I’ve had anywhere, with several good shrimp and sausage bits in it, plus plenty of rice and a nice red pepper kick that made the spiciest thing I’ve found on the menu so far.

At the time my family and I dined in, they were testing something in place of the regular coleslaw, that they were calling Swamp Slaw.  It was white corn with tomatoes, cucumbers and a homemade ranch dressing, with light seasoning.  It’s not something I’d want but my family member who tried it absolutely raved about it, since it was so flavorful and out of the ordinary.  She also had onion rings instead of fries and they were a thumbs up from everyone, too.  The onions were sweet and the batter was crisp and crunchy without being messy.

The other diner in our group had the spicy sausage po-boy and he enjoyed it, but complained that it was not the least bit spicy even by our bland local standards.

We’ve also had a chance to try the beignets and they are very good, too.  They’re not nearly as big as some of the ones I’ve had elsewhere here or in New Orleans but they are cooked just right, with a fluffy interior and crisp exterior, and of course plenty of powdered sugar.  A fitting end to an excellent meal.

Overall, a really good experience.  It’s not a big place, and it’s definitely out of the way but worth seeking out.  If there’s one complaint to lodge, it’s the lack of a fountain drink dispenser; they only offer bottles of Coke products and Gold Peak tea, which is not ideal.  Still, that’s a minor quibble for what is an otherwise really, really good authentic New Orleans-style po-boy.

resp.text: Thank you very much for all of your honesty we greatly appreciate it. We are happy we could bring a little bit of Louisiana to Alabama. Hope to see you again soon.

name: lanya bass
text: I’m not a big fan of fried seafood, but I ordered the fried shrimp poboy, with the voodoo sauce, and I really enjoyed it! I recommend the shrimp poboy with a side of the garlic parmesan pot wedges! I would give 6 stars, but the maximum is 5!!

resp.text: Thank you!!! Awesome to hear we appreciate it a lot 😍

name: gerald bandura
text: Shrimp po boy and gumbo was excellent. Service fast and friendly.

resp.text: Thank you lots. We are so glad you enjoyed it.  Hope to see you again. 😊

name: Lisa Wilson
text: Food was good very friendly people little to hot in restaurants to enjoy food

resp.text: We do apologize and plan on getting that straightened out ASAP. Hope you will give us another chance in the near future thank you.

name: Bryan Robinson
text: We are from chattanooga Tennessee and.found this little slice of New Orleans and it was awesome had the shrimp poboy and jambalya, will make this a have to when passing through.

resp.text: We are happy you all enjoyed. Have a safe trip and hope to see you guys again. Thank you lots.

name: Darrell Balsamo
text: I try something different when I eat their never dissatisfied with the what I order

resp.text: You have no idea how much that means to us. We are happy to have you as an official regular 🥰 thank you!!

name: Terry Stokes
text:
WHO DAT MAK'N DEM PO BOY'S?
I CAN TASTE 'EM ALL THE WAY FROM THE FREE STATE!!

name: Crystal Driscoll
text: (Admittingly I eat here probably more often than I should) this Popeye's location has the best customer service, absolute freshest and hottest food!  I would drive all the way across town just to get to this particular location! Hot food..fair price;) (They even take into account when you place an order for chicken tenders; if the chicken tenders run small they make sure to add extra pieces to make it fair).  Popeye's chicken tenders  will never be topped!

name: laz foot
text:
Good chicken, good service, the staff will bend the rules on the coupons if you are nice to them.   The company must really ride their employees hard because at the end of their shift, in the parking lot, they do NOT look happy.

Their chicken beats the hell out of KFC.

name: Joseph Tracy
text: Ordered some chicken tenders and cajun fries, was told to pull forward past the window, and then I proceeded to wait ten minutes for my food.  Three other cars got their food before me.  When I finally went inside my food was waiting on the counter.  Second time this has happened to me.  Never again will I go to this location.  No apology or anything.  Terrible customer service.  I should have made a bigger fuss but I was in a hurry.

name: JERRY MCKEE
text: We go here to eat almost every time we come to Huntsville🤗 It is just the BEST 😜

name: Sam Woodson
text: Had the buffet, I like getting some chicken livers, but not enough to buy a full order so the buffet is great. Also, you can put as much gravy on your potatoes as you want! Banana pudding too! It's kind of crowded. I wish they had to the buffet at one of the other locations in Huntsville that are closer.

name: BARFLEY Bjork
text: A shiny smile after lunch means you just had a good time - BARFLEY

name: William Scott
text: I prefer this location to the south parkway one. They seem to take greater care cooking their food.

name: Aaron Hearne
text: Good chicken! The only one with a buffet for miles! Maybe in the state!

name: Monette Watts
text: great chicken, great service

name: Phillip Wagner Jr.
text: GREAT Food great service

name: Neymar Hardin
text: I admire this spot! They offer marvelous food, they have a rich menu, The cook in that spot is very experienced, I like a lot eating all their food. The dishes are consistently good, the attitude towards the customers  is agreeable. I often go to  this place and I not even once was unsatisfied. I recommend it to all.

name: Brian Ivins
text: Excellent food great service I will return here if ever in this area again. I ate the fried gator , red beans and rice and their award winning ultimate gumbo. Yummmmy!!!!!

name: Lloyd Merkel
text: Exceptional food, nice employees, consistently fantastic atmosphere. They charge reasonable pricing and the food quality is good. Highly recommended.

name: Chase Simmons
text: Cajun food and the setting at this location is super good. Food is similar to a place in San Francisco I loved.

name: Bill Daniels
text: Wonderful food.. truly a "hidden" treasure in Bessemer.  Great service.

name: Jameka “JayEssTee” Thomas
text: A great place to eat. Family owned business. Great atmosphere.

name: Linda Fincher-Mason
text: Talipia was big pieces and batter great. Yummy gumbo available as a side item. Great hushpuppies and extra yummy house shrimp with just a touch of cornmeal

name: Heather Moore
text: If you haven't tried Boateng's Ultimate Gumbo, you are missing out! All the seafood we have tried has been absolutely delicious! I recommend everyone try it, you will be back!

name: Alana Bennett
text: Overall atmosphere was nice and the servers were nice. The food is good but not amazing. The customers are very diverse as well as the staff. The reason for three stars is the wait was quite long. I went with two people and there food arrived at least 20 minutes before mine. I believe it may have just been the lunch rush. My food was hot when I got it. So if you are prepared to wait then you’ll have a good experience. It’s a nice little whole in the wall.

name: Maria Verduzco
text: Passing through from Texas, looking for some good southern food.This place had an Old time feel. We had the catfish, chicken-sausage gumbo,mac and cheese, okra....Great food, awesome customer service, mac and cheese was old school greatness! Taste as if were made from scratch! Definitely would recommend. Prices are reasonable.🙂

name: Valencia Moore
text: Good is great here.  It is small but food is great.  My husband  loves the gumbo.  He orders it everytime  he  goes.  The only thing that we don't  like is they run out of food early.

name: Neene Austin
text: I haven't eaten here in over a year, so today I decided I would give them a try... In the past I have always ordered the Shrimp Bisque. It was always thick and rich and good. I ordered it today it is watery and the toasted bread taste like GREASE. I am not sure how some people toast their bread but I have never had toasted bread that taste just like cooking oil (GROSS)... I am very unhappy with what I purchased.The food taste and  quality sucks now..... Disappointed once again, i don't know what happened but the food now verses when they first open. There is no competition.... Its like they changed recipes or some. This Shrimp Bisque is HORRIBLE!!

name: Kelsey
text: Great locally owned food and good service. Perfectly seasoned and varied menu items! It's a hidden gem for sure! That treat you like family and won't disappoint! If you're on the fence, try this place!

name: Butch Hallmark
text: Food is incredible. In. Cred. I. Ble. Aesthetically, the place is a bit on the rougher side. Decals of names all over the walls coupled with the children's toys outside the restaurant. While it doesn't make for a good restaurant setting, you can feel the sense of family here. I know they are about to renovate to make room for their buffets or something, so maybe that will help. I wish someone would donate a truck load of money to help this family owned business remodel their dining room. The food they produce deserves better. I will definitely be back.

name: Xander Felargo
text: I had never heard of such a place before. The atmosphere in this place is homey. The workers where nice and the foid was tasty. I ordered the Grouper Po Boy with gumbo/rice as a side. The Po Boy was already tasty by itself but with the added homemade tartar sauce the sandwich was really tasty. The gumbo with rice on top was also tasty but a little spicy. The whole meal cost 6.59 tax included. Such a low price for such delicious food. Totally recommend this place.

name: Sunil Dudi
text: Love the simple Cajun food they have.  It looks like a family run operation.  The service is a little slow, but people are nice and the food is great.

name: latoya Burton
text: They did not Calamari when it was on the menu.

name: Mz. L Bloxom
text: Let me begin by saying, the food was delicious, but the service and decor needs improvement. This is my second poor experience.  At least my husband got his food this time. The owner(s) has the potential to take this restaurant to another level, but the understaffing, lack of professional presentation, and the unavailability of many of the side items on the menu made this another negative experience for my husband and I. I was hoping for a commendable experience, but I was disappointed again. If you want a take out meal, this is your place.  I wanna give Boateng 5 stars, but I CANNOT.  Boateng, make your"Restaurant Impossible" a sure possibility.✌

name: Steve Winfield
text: Been there a few times. I always love it but wife doesn't. (She's from Illinois) Fried grouper fantastic as are fried green tomatoes. Every thing I've ordered has been great. Wife don't like pasta & Friday they were out of mashed potatoes & baked potatoes. Fries were not edible. Her fried shrimp were very good though. They have many sides to choose from, just not potatoes. As far as Bessemer choices go it's well worth a try. If you go on Friday or Saturday night expect a 30 minute wait. Two words: Grouper & Tomatoes!

name: La'Toya Fletcher
text: Horrible customer service!!! Called for over an hour and no one answered the phone for a pick up order. When I arrived,  they were very nonchalant, told me that it would be 20 minutes on the order, I've been here for 45 minutes,  just getting my order with no apology for the rude customer service, the elusiveness of the owner and waitresses, and just plain disrespected. I've been patronizing and recommending this establishment to the public for years, but not anymore.    I hosted our family Christmas Dinner here 2 years ago. But, Boateng won't have to worry about me, my money, nor referrals again!!!

name: Food Gossiper
text: This was our second time coming here. The first time was amazing! The food was good and the servers had a great attitude. Second time around something was different. Every single item we ordered we had to substitute because they didn't have it (keep in mind we got there as soon as they opened) the server seemed like she was lost. The food, the food was not on point. It taste bland and we had to wait forever to get it. On top of waiting for the food we had to wait forever for one side that I ordered. After awhile the server said they didn't have it so I got something else. After another half hour of waiting for that the server said she was gonna give us a discount for us waiting. We went to pay and told the lady about the discount....she said for what.  This is the last time we will spend our money at this restaurant. It's a shame that this happened because we really loved this place.

name: ToddFelicia Posey
text: I am talking about The Best food in Bessemer! Awesome and beautiful preparation! Exquisite taste for great prices. The staff treat you like family, on point preparedness...... God has blessed this place and people. You can sense it when you walk in the door! Ty!

name: Mary Ann Stephens
text: Kinda disappointed.   I live in Helena and had ordered to go Calamari.   I don't know what happened  but it was nothing but hard circled leather.  I usually am a big fan of y'alls and when in Bessemer  eat there .  Did y'all change seafood distributor?

name: Susan Smith
text: Food is always good but service needs work. We had taken a friend for lunch. He was told his shrimp and grits would be a few minutes. It arrived after we had all finished eating and ordered desert. I wish the server had said it would take 20-30 minutes on the grits not just brought them with desert.

name: Brittny Nicole
text: The food is so good! You have to try it at least once. The place is homey and the staff is very sweet and caring. The owner is the bomb dot com. I love her and I have a great time everytime I eat here.

name: Michelle Eaton
text: Great food, great service, extremely long wait time. But that is just because they have so many orders it’s hard for them to keep up. Wish they would open up another location in a different area. There are shrimp and crab bisque is out of this world especially especially if it’s fresh. Their Cajun quesadilla is humongous and two could eat off of it.

name: Kevin Cunningham
text: The food was delicious. Growing up in New Orleans, I appreciate seafood done right. From the prize-winning gumbo to the blackened catfish and jambalaya, everything was seasoned and prepared just right.

name: Ryke Franklin
text: I can't say enough about the staff of this place. Even if the food wasn't excellent, the service alone would keep me coming back. Genuinely nice people. Arguably the best lunch in the area (The Bright Star being the only other possible contender). Uncontested best deal.

name: Leslie Ellis
text:
We just left this restaurant and have been many times before, but this time the service was absolutely awful!
First, it took about 20 minutes to get a waitress who then forgot to bring us lemon with the tea. They were out of gumbo my husband ordered,   but did not tell us for about a half hour.  The waitress then I asked if my husband would like to order something else and he did order a salad with crab meat on it. That salad never came. The salad, which I ordered, took about 40 minutes to come. When my husband complained to the kitchen person, he picked up an order on the counter and  asked if this was our order, but it was not. Clearly, they did not keep track of their orders.
The salad I did get was fresh, but the crabmeat was soggy.
We won’t be going back.

name: Nise 2You
text: The wait is long, because it is made fresh. The food is amazing!! They are out of items because the crowd comes early to get this good food. It’s amazing! I am glad I discovered it.

name: Larry Futrell
text: Our first experience and it won't be the last!! Had the fried green tomatoes covered with fresh crab meat and drizzled with Cajun mustard sauce was to die for!! The best gumbo of all times. Sausage and shrimp pasta extravaganza was outstanding. The peach/apple cobbler for my birthday topped off  the whole meal!! You will not be disappointed!! Best Cajun outside of New Orleans!!!

name: Carolyn Ensley
text: The food is always amazing. Yes, you might have to wait on it to get to your table, but that's because it's made to order. I have no problem waiting for fresh food!

name: Barbara Hurst
text: Horrible restaurant.  I will never go back!!  Service was terrible!  Had to ask several times for our drinks only to be told by our waitress that she had to bring everything at once!!  And AC was not working properly.  Very uncomfortable.  When we asked for lots of ice in our drinks our waitress said that we were taking all of her ice!!  And they were out of several main items on their menu, such as red beans and rice!!  While we were there we saw at least three tables of customers get up and leave.  Waitress came up to our table and took our tartar sauce to give to another table without even asking us or replacing it.  The ONLY reason I gave this place one star is because the food was pretty good.  But definitely not worth going back.  What a shame they don't take more pride in their restaurant.

name: Schoolyb 2
text: I love non food chain eateries. This place is pretty authentic, even down to the housemade sauces. I will keep going back until I've tried everything on the menu.

name: nightlife with The afterlife
text: Its definitely not because of the food. I was having to wait for the girl to get change. Which meant her running to the bank. This is something you definitely should be prepared for.

name: Valerie Gaines
text: This restaurant has great food! The prices are a bit overboard and the service stinks. If you are looking to visit, it's best to order takeout ahead and go home and enjoy. The restaurant is small, crowded and tables are tightly fit. Servers need more customer service experience and table manners.

name: L Montgomery
text: It's all good ...ultimate gumbo!!! Shrimp and grits fried grouper fried cat fish and a beautiful young lady from New Jersey bringing amazing Cajun creations to Birmingham Alabama I need her food in my hometown Allentown Pennsylvania

name: Crimson Angel
text: Took my whole family there for my husband's birthday. Its a small hole in the wall, and be ready to wait for your food. But it is so worth it. We all ordered something different so we could try a little bit of everything. The staff were wonderful, the food was amazing. I would recommend this place to anyone.

name: Shundria Jones
text: I came in here at 11:38 AM AND LEAVE WITH NOTHING AT 12:40 yes I’m highly pissed!! The lady ask what I was having I told her what I wanted, and I go check to see where my order was, her reply I didn’t do her ticket but let a white person come in she running behind they ass for a tip. I loved this place, but they forget my service, never again All I get after wasting my time sitting is a sorry we didn’t get your order.

name: Brian Mealer
text: Bessemer's best kept secret. Excellent Cajun food. One of my most favorite restaurants.

name: Latasha Singleton
text: This is one of my favorite restaurants EVER. They have the BEST SHRIMP I've ever had. Can't get enough! So happy to have discovered this place 5 yrs ago!!!

name: Peyton Bowles
text: Delicious food, amazing staff who are well educated on the menu. Tiffany was more than helpful, courteous, and is one of the best waitresses I've ever had the pleasure to dine with. I highly recommend grabbing a plate of friend green tomatoes with your lunch, as well, because they rival what my momma can cook! Boateng's truly is "Bessemer's best kept secret"!!

name: Hayhay Moore
text: First time eating there. The waitress and staff are very friendly and the food was perfect. They have the best gator I have ever had, it melts in your mouth. We went around lunchtime and got our food pretty quickly. We are definitely coming back!

name: Mark Hill
text: I had the crawfish and lump crab salad with a side if soft shell crabs. Outstanding. CHAD waited on me and gave me a sample of their award winning seafood gumbo.  Great flavor but not for the sensitive pallet because it's spicy. Just the way I like it. I mean clear tour sinus spicy

name: TheSouthernSoul P Butler
text: Great food but the worse customer service everytime I have eaten or placed a to-go order. They are in need of restructuring how they take orders and respond to customers. Sad that Bessemer doesn't have more choices.

name: Chadwick Loriot
text: Y'all this is really a great place to eat. I worked here and it can be crazy but you can't beat the food..... Love the people and the atmosphere. Something bout that Boatengs.... Miss y'all. Miss that bisque too...!

name: Crystal Shoults
text: LOVED IT! VERY FRIENDLY WAITRESS! EVERY ORDER IS COOKED TO ORDER, SO DON'T COME EXPECTING FAST SERVICE...BUT I PROMISE THE WAIT IS VERY MUCH WORTH IT! I GOT THE SHRIMP & GRITS...IT WAS DELICIOUS!

name: Paul Terry
text: The food was good. Great even. The service was incredibly slow. Much slower than one might expect when the dining room was only about 2/3 full.

name: Carin Carter
text: I travel to Alabama from Miami for work and this has become the number one reason to come to Alabama. The staff is beyond friendly and corrects any mishap within moments and smiles that light up the rest of your day. Now for the food, it is excellent. I have eaten almost everything on the menu and have not had one bad meal. My absolute favorite is the broccoli.  You must eat here and leave room for desert because the blackberry cobbler and banana pudding is to die for.

name: Texas NeeNee
text: We are traveling from Texas and made a pit stop in Bessemer on our way to Orlando. We always look for places off the beaten path. This place is a gem! Great food! Great service! Friendly staff! Wish we had a place like this at home! ❤️

name: K Campbell
text: They lost my ticket and it took about 40 minutes to get my food. It was good when it finally came. They made up for my wait by giving me a free cup of gumbo to go.

name: LePoris Jackson
text: Simply the best independent restaurants in the Bessemer/ Birmingham area. Delicious offerings and fast and friendly service. You must give them a visit.

name: Dev Cheatam
text: The food was great, but the service was incredibly slow. There were only a few people in the establishment. My lady and I had wanted to go to Olive Garden for dinner, instead I decided to go to Boateng

name: Frank Smith
text: No clue how the food is because i never got my order after being there for over an hour! Got there at 8pm at 8:05 i asked some guy do we seat ourselves or what because no one said anything to me. I set down at a table and a min later they tell me to move because they had to clean. Ok so I moved to a booth 15min later she finally brings me a menu and i put my order of gumbo in at 8:30 so I didn't order anything hard or that would take very long to prepare. There was only 8 people in there when i got there and at 9:08 when i finally had enough and left there was only 3 of us!

name: Kris
text: Food is great, whenever available. Many menu options are never available, which defeats the entire purpose.

name: Denice Vines
text: We used to love this place. We hope they correct their problems. The first time we tried to get food to go, they were out of shrimp. The second time, it seemed like they were frustrated and after waiting 15 min decided they were not taking to go orders. Would love to give them 5 stars once issues are corrected.

name: Mark Gernhart
text: The food here is amazing. Everything we had was fresh, and very tasty. The waitress did a great job, and the food arrived in a timely manner. This will be a regular place for me and my family from now on.

name: Robbies Miracle
text: I actually loved it! The quality of the food was great! Yes, there is a wait, yes there is a crowd. However, I expect that from a small establishment in high demand. It's a personal touch that so many restaurants lack. Can't wait to go back.

name: Erika M
text: I have always like the food, but it tends to be extremely crowded due to the size of the building. Also.... There was hair in the big container of water that they use to refill glasses. There is no telling how many people's water was refilled from that container before I pointed it out.

name: Kim Salter
text: Water bug (roach)crawled across my foot while eating 😭 Also Hot inside. To hot to enjoy food.

name: Brandon Easterwood
text: Great food. Need to hire a couple more hands though. Very busy with not enough help. But the food was worth it. Otherwise would've been 5 star.

name: tobithia mckinney
text:
I had the fish platter. The fish was  fried hard  and very Hot just like I like it. The turnip greens was very good. The hush puppies was good and hot, with pieces of corn in them. Tea was sweet with slice lemons. My only complaint is the fish and the hush puppies was greasey. If they could have been drained some. They were out of Dessert.😱
Don't get me wrong DINNER was Delicious, just kind of greasey. Will I go  back. Yes I will but this time, I will put my fish between some paper towels.  Hopefully enjoy some dessert too.

name: michelle starks
text: My fiance and I went here and the service was awful, when we walked in the cashier was on her cell phone with the blue tooth in her ear, finally she said to us if we're dining in we can go sit wherever we wanted to sit, we get our food ordered, less than 5 minutes into eating our food, my fiancee finds a long golden blonde string of hair in his fish and tartar sauce, I see that the cashier is busy with other customers so I see another employee walking from the back with "golden blonde hair" with no hair net on, which we later find out is the owner because one of her cooks told us she was the owner, I asked if she could come here for a minute but she turns and head back towards the kitchen, totally ignored me, my fiancee then goes towards the kitchen to try and get someone's attention and he starts to try and tell them about the hair in his food and the was completely disrespected, the owner went off on him, it was awful, later the cashier admitted to the hair being the owner's hair, we were charged for my food because I decided to keep mines because I'm not gonna lie, my food was good but my fiancee didn't want anything else, wasn't offered anything else either. We were still made to pay for my food. I feel like the way the situation was handled, the owner should have came and apologized and gave us our meals for free because she was wrong....our 1st and last time patronizing their business....we try and support black businesses and this is what you get....smh

name: S Young
text: Love this little restaurant.  Blackened shrimp and red beans and rice are great. The banana pudding is the best I've ever had.

name: Trilisa Witherspoon
text: Quaint diner in the heart of wonderful Bessemer. Meals cooked to order and worth the wait.  Deliciously tasty each time.

name: The Norris'
text: It's the absolute best Cajun food I've ever had.  We had the chance to experience this place while attending the Taste of Bessemer event.  It was so good, we went the next day. It's now the day after (the next) and we are trying to stop ourselves from going back lol.  At the restaurant, Greg assisted us and he was very pleasant and welcoming.  The prices are reasonable and worth every penny for the quality of food that you receive.  You have to go and taste this food!

name: Shakira Grimes

name: Taylor Neal
text:
Ate there just a few minutes ago with a friend. It's a very rare occasion that I'll rate a place after eating it only once, but this one is one of the few.
First off, the atmosphere is fantastic. Decorated in a very comfortable set up, when you walk through the doors, you feel like you're visiting grandma. It's part of the historic district in Bessemer, and belongs to the Historical Homeowners Association, and the feel is authentic.
The service is stupendous. We didn't immediately declare that we were first timers, but as soon as we did the server piped up with a big grin and said "Welcome home." Boy did it feel like it.  She was there for us any time we needed her, friendly and always had a big smile. It really did feel welcoming.
The food is outrageously good, and not at outrageously high prices. I had a Fried Crawfish PoBoy, and my friend had the Fried Shrimp PoBoy. My goodness. Fried to perfection, accompanied by delicious home-made sauces... the food was fantastic. We had a sandwich, fries and drink for under $10. I'd recommend it to anyone who enjoys seafood.
My friend and I will certainly be returning; it feels good to go home.

name: JP Kaal
text:
I'm just an accountant, and a cooking aficionado.

This is my favorite Cajun place in Birmingham.  I live in Vestavia so it is a little off the beaten path from Southside or Over the Mountain, but is worth the trip if you're ever driving out to Tuscaloosa or just in Bessemer.

The service is very slow, but that is part of the experience, so be prepared.  So why 5 stars???  The food is why you should try this place out.  Decor, service, and location (although new location by Bessemer Railroad Museum is night and day better than Watermark Place) aren't special, but the value of the food itself mitigates all the other factors and still earns it a 5 in my book.

I recommend the food prepared blackened or sauteed.  Every entree and side is just a step above what I would expect for the price point.  For instance, the black eyed peas are my favorite side and about 2 or 3 stars better than what you would get at a meat and 3.  The downside is that they will raise your standards, and most other places offerings will seem sub-par going forward.

The deserts are all excellent, but I recommend the bread pudding with whiskey sauce above all others.  They have a wide variety of options on the menu but not be in stock so be prepared 3 several choices.  The good thing is all the food is delicious.

Make it an experience, or just order take out.  Either way you shouldn't be disappointed considering that in that location, Boateng's is a relative culinary island.

name: Derique Green
text: My friends and I decided at the last minute to visit Botang's in Bessemer.  Upon our arrival, the teenage greeter, who was sitting at the entrance breastfeeding her baby says, "Dine in or carry out".  We said dine in.  She responds by saying, "It's too late, you have to carry out."  Well, why give us that option?  She goes on to say, "You can take the menu's into the hall and someone will come to take your order."  During our wait, we watched as another unsatisfied customer requested assistance.  When the employees, refused to help her, she vowed, "I'll never come back here."  We were enjoying one another's company when we realized that about 10 minutes had passed and no one had come to take our order.  So, we entered the main dinning room again to be told someone will be out shortly.  When we mentioned we'd been waiting for over 10 minutes for someone, they decided to take our order.  All of the people we encountered from the greeter to the cashier seemed angry that we were there and irritated by our presence.  So, I asked to speak with the owner.  I spoke with the HUSBAND and he apologized and promised to try to do better.  End of story, so we thought.  The WIFE comes into the hallway where we were waiting and told us, since you have a problem watching my daughter breastfeed her child then DON'T COME BACK.  Of course, I responded by saying, "Absolutely no problem!"  At that point, we were skeptical about eating the food they were preparing for us.  So, we asked for a refund.  The teenage immature breastfeeding mom starts screaming and says, "Mom, come out and give them they refund cause I can't do it.  ima about to go off. Give them they money back cause they need the money more than we do."  Now, this CHILD is going off and the owner, the mother, the wife, screams, someone CALL THE POLICE!  Really, your child is the instigator, the problem.  I guess she thought that was going to scare us.  But we patient waited on our refund.  As we waited, the other waitresses stood nearby making comments like, "I mean, it's ok, I can take the food home.  It's no problem.  The food will be eaten."  All of this was so unprofessional and there is obviously no concern for customer service at this place.  #nomoreBotangs

name: Carolina Lecaros
text:
(Translated by Google) The food is excellent! It seems that everything is prepared at the moment. I take a star from them because the last two times I have gone to eat they have had the air conditioning broken, they have a large fan pointed at the kitchen to give some air to the cooks who perspire a lot. There is no ventilation and when you leave you come out with all the smell of food impregnated in your hair and clothes. It is the only thing I can object to. Otherwise it is one of the favorite restaurants.

(Original)
La comida es excelente! Pareciera que todo lo preparan al momento. Les quito una estrella porque las dos ultimas veces que he ido a comer han tenido el aire acondicionado malogrado, tienen un ventilador grande apuntando a la cocina para darles un poco de aire a los cocineros quienes transpiran mucho. No hay ventilación y al salir sales con todo el olor a comida impregnado en el cabello y en la ropa. Es lo único que les puedo objetar. Por lo demás es uno de los restaurantes favoritos.

name: JASON BURNS
text: I've heard great things about this place! Me, and the other Barbers @ Marvelous Cuts have been trying to order food from this place for weeks now! Last Saturday they weren't cooking, and Now we can't even get someone to answer the phone!.... We would love to try your food! Please reach out to us!

resp.text: Thanks Jason for the feedback. We've been working soft opening on the weekend to try to work out the kinks you named.  We will most definitely reach out to you asap! I will stop by your establishment this week to introduce myself and see how I can be of service. Thanks again!

name: Buddha 3g
text: I've been in Alabama for six years. So far this place has the best food I've eaten since I've been here. The owner and staff are second to none. This will be a regular stop for me.

resp.text: Your comment is good to my soul - thank you so much for the support. Come back and see us - we now have a rewards program where you can earn points and receive discounts.

name: Mel Bowers
text: Ok, what what Can't I say. Amazing..Well seasoned. Great service. New Orleans Style Food and its amazing. Worth every second of the drive. Please try this restaurant OMG. Being a food fanatic I can't stop talking about it.

resp.text: Mel, it was such a pleasure to meet you this past week and happy that you enjoyed your meal. Looking forward to seeing you again :-)

name: Nicole Cecil
text: New favorite place ever! Love the food and the people are even BETTER! LOVE LOVE LOVE IT HERE....

resp.text: Nicole - thank you so much for your comment and the rating. We pride our selves on providing a delicious meal and even better customer service. Thank you for the opportunity to serve you and yours and look forward to seeing you again. .

name: Mr Information
text: Good food. Need better hours.... 2-8 on Saturdays. That's when people look for food especially in this community

resp.text: 2-8 huh?! Great feedback!! Thank you we are definitely trying to grow into what the community wants. Currently we are trying to hire and hopefully that will assist with better hours. As of now we are a catering company that like to push out pop up Louisiana inspired menus on the weekend. Hopefully we’ll meet soon!! In God’s plan!!❤️

name: Spencer Brooks
text: The food was great. Friendly service and a all around great atmosphere.

resp.text: Spencer - so glad you came out and took part in the festivities. We are humbled and thank you for your support.

name: Jennifer Malone
text: Phenomenal food from the bayous of Louisiana!! The andouille sausage is the real deal!! Welcome it all, especially the ettoufe!!

resp.text: Jennifer, thanks so much for your comment and rating. Glad you enjoyed the (aye-too-faye), we really put alot of Love into it. Hope to see you soon. Grand Opening coming up this Saturday the 12th  from 10-7 with food, DJ, Bingo, raffles, prices, vendors and of course our House Specialty Boudin Balls :-)

name: Anthony Jolly
text: The crawfish and boudin balls take be back to living in the delta. People please stop by and get you some wonderful food from the bayou.

resp.text: Thanks Anthony! We pride ourselves in bringing the authentic flavor from the bayou. Come back us and see us!

name: lillian aguilera
text: Besides me leaving my card😅 it was a great experience didn’t take to long and I LOVE the crawfish etouffee

resp.text: Thanks Lillian!! We’ve been getting great reviews on the crawfish etouffee. We’ll make sure to keep this in stock!! Thanks again!!

name: K Spencer
text: The food is great! I will be back tomorrow for the Pasta Mardi Gras.

resp.text: Thank you so much! We pride ourselves in cooking authentic recipes.  Hope you enjoyed the pasta!! See you soon!

name: Richard Jones
text: This place has great food just needs to open a little longer

resp.text: Thanks Richard and we are truly working toward longer hours and open up more. We are a catering company first and those hours conflict but we are trying to hire a staff to accommodate the demand within the community. In Gods plan we’ll get there. Thanks again for the review and feedback it means a lot!!

name: Deb Alvarez
text: The food and service excellent! The atmosphere was great and the prices are affordable! I can't wait to go back! Go check it out!
